newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 1.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 1.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open to larger ships on Tuesday, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1000 local/1600 GMT daily meteorological report.

Crude port Pajaritos in Veracruz state reopened at 0800 local/1400 GMT after being closed on Monday at 1745 local/2345 GMT. The nation's two other main crude ports, Cayo Arcas and Dos Bocas, remained open as a cold front blew through the region.

Residual effects of the waning front kept Veracruz, Coatzacoalcos, Alvarado, Nautla, Frontera and Puerto Penasco ports closed to smaller tourism and fishing boats as winds reached up to 40 km per hour.

The SCT warned smaller ships of increasing wind speeds and dangerous waves along the Pacific coast of Baja California and Sonora states and advised of poor weather conditions in the southern Gulf of Mexico and the Yucatan canal.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Pacific Coast, the Gulf of Mexico and the Caribbean.

Weak cold front lowering temperatures along northern coast with winds clocked at 15 to 20 knots (28 to 38 km/16 to 22 miles per hour) and waves at nine to 12 feet high and waves five to eight feet high. Light isolated rains along coasts of Sinaloa, Nayarit, Oaxaca and Chiapas states.
Cloudy along coast of Tamaulipas and Veracruz states with lighter winds as cold front moves to southern gulf region. Maximum winds at 15 to 20 knots with waves five to seven feet high.
Partly cloudy with some rains, winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
